# useMenuHandler

Returns properties to be added to the button which displays a menu and to the menu item list element.
Rendered menu items must have `role="menuitem"` and `data-index={<index>}`.

## Parameters

| Param                  | Type          | Description                                    |
| ---------------------- | ------------- | ---------------------------------------------- |
| expanded               | `boolean`     | whether the menu is expanded.                  |
| setExpanded            | `function`    | function invoked to change `expanded`.         |
| items                  | `Array.<any>` | the menu items.                                |
| options                | `Object`      | the options.                                   |
| options.getItemText    | `function`    | returns the item text.                         |
| options.isItemDisabled | `function`    | returns whether the item is disabled.          |
| options.onItemSelected | `function`    | invoked when the item is selected by the user. |

## Returns

`Object`

## Example

```js
import {useCallback, useState} from 'react';
import {useMenuHandler} from '@bluecateng/pelagos';

const items = ['item0'];
const getItemText = (item) => ''; // return text for item

const Example = () => {
	const [expanded, setExpanded] = useState(false);
	const handleItemSelected = useCallback((item) => {
		// handle menu item selection
	}, []);
	const {current, buttonProps, listProps} = useMenuHandler(expanded, setExpanded, items, {
		getItemText,
		onItemSelected: handleItemSelected,
	});
	return (
		<div>
			<button {...buttonProps}>...</button>
			<ul {...listProps} role="menu">
				...
			</ul>
		</div>
	);
};
```
